name: Grumpy Old Goats
description:
Grumpy Old Goats is a two-player Unity 3D game survival game created for the Gamerella 2019 Game Jam and inspired by "RUMBLE".

To play in your browser, here is the webGL link (Unity) :

Grumpy Old Goats (Unity webGL)

Credits:

Ange Missy - 3d Animation and Modelling

Ariana Hipsagh - 3d Animation, rigging and sound

Marc-Antoine Lecuyer - Unity programming

Martin-John Hearty - Unity programming

This two-player game features two Grumpy Old Goats frolicking in the Alps.  

This survival race game takes place across five lanes.  Players can switch lanes.  Each player can sabotage the other by placing obstacles in their path.  Players can switch lanes to avoid the rhinoceros stampedes which can be anticipated by listening for the impending rumble and seeing the corresponding lane vibrations.   If the player does not switch lanes in time, they are killed by the stampede of rhinoceros.

Player 1 uses the keyboard keys "W" and "D"  and player 2 uses the arrow keys (left and right)  to navigate the lanes.  Use the "S" key and the down arrow key to place red wasing machine obstacles.  Collecting a yellow obstacle will activate the boost which makes the player go faster for a short lapse of time.

Oh-OH... There is an avalanche in the Alps that forces the players to retrace their steps.  Each player must  avoid the obstacles that were placed on the tracks before they are engulfed by the swirling snow.

If only, the goats knew that collaboration was the secret to success !  They would both be safe.

Sources:

Sounds were sourced from FreeSound.org.  Rhinoceros were sourced from the Unity Asset Library.
